name: Alex Buijs
title: Alex Buijs Web Development
job_title: Freelance Ruby on Rails Web Developer
description: Alex Buijs is a Utrecht based freelance web developer specialized in the Ruby on Rails web framework

projects.description:
For YoungCapital, Alex created cross platform mobile applications and their API. The applications are used for applying to jobs or registering declarations, among many other things.

Techniques used: Cordova, Backbone, Marionette, Browserify, Gulp, Coffeescript, Vue.js, Webpack, ES6, SASS.
For Digidentity, Alex contributed to DigiD, the identity management platform for the Dutch government. Techniques used: Rails, Coffeescript, HAML, SASS.

For Yellowbrick, a customer of Kabisa, Alex made a cross platform mobile application with Cordova (PhoneGap). The application is basically a single-page HTML5 web application, wrapped in a native WebView.

Techniques used: Rails (for it's asset pipeline), Backbone, Marionette, RequireJS, Emblem.js, Coffeescript, SASS.

For Seacon Logistics, a customer of Kabisa, Alex made a cross platform mobile application with Cordova (PhoneGap). The application is basically a single-page HTML5 web application, wrapped in a native WebView.

Techniques used: Rails (for it's asset pipeline and backend API), Backbone, Marionette, Bootstrap, Coffeescript, SASS.

For IDT Capture, a customer of Kabisa, Alex made a cross platform mobile application with Cordova (PhoneGap). The application is basically a single-page HTML5 web application, wrapped in a native WebView.

Techniques used: Rails (for it's asset pipeline and backend API), Backbone, Marionette, Bootstrap, Coffeescript, SASS.

For Ultimaker, a customer of Kabisa, Alex contributed to YouMagine.com, a social platform for sharing 3D print designs.

Techniques used: Ruby on Rails, Coffeescript, SASS, Slim, Bootstrap, PostgreSQL, Redis, Test Driven Development, Heroku.

For Ultimaker, a customer of Kabisa, Alex contributed to YouMagine.com, a social platform for sharing 3D print designs.

Techniques used: Ruby on Rails, Coffeescript, SASS, Slim, Bootstrap, PostgreSQL, Redis, Test Driven Development, Heroku.

For Philips, a customer of Ciber, Alex contributed to the creation of light-collector.com, a social platform for sharing images.

Techniques used: Ruby on Rails, Coffeescript, Haml, SASS, PostgreSQL, Amazon S2, Nginx, Unicorn.

For Philips, a customer of Ciber, Alex contributed to the creation of the cross-platform mobile application Lighting Hub. It is used for browsing the entire Philips Lighting Catalogue.

Techniques used: Titanium, Coffeescript, SQLite.

For Malmberg, a customer of Ciber, Alex contributed over several periods of time, to the creation and expansion of the Malmberg Publishing Platform, a new generation of teaching methods.

Techniques used: Ruby on Rails, Coffeescript, Haml, SASS, SQL Server, Apache, Passenger.
